SEARCH
Package com.oblong.jelly

Interface PoolServer

All Known Implementing Classes:
Server
public interface PoolServer
Interface defining pool operations against a specific server.

This interface abstracts over pool servers, which are entities giving you access to a set of pools, allowing also disposal and the creation of new ones.

Usually, a pool server is actually an external process to which the client connects using a network protocol, but nothing in the jelly interfaces precludes other kinds of servers. From the client side, one can thus treat servers as modifiable collections of pools. That said, the most common case is by far that of a server accessed using the TCP scheme.

The concrete nature of the pool server is described by the scheme of its PoolServerAddress, which also serves as the universal resource identifier for the server. To obtain an instance of this class associated to a given address, use the factory method Pool.getServer(com.oblong.jelly.PoolServerAddress).

All the operations defined in this interface can also be performed by means of the static methods in Pool, that will spare you the trouble (in case that's a trouble) of having to deal with PoolServer instances at all.

See Also:

  • Method Details

    • address

      PoolServerAddress address()
      The address and URI of this server.

    • name

      String name()
      Name of the server, for display purposes. It's guaranteed to be unique within a given scheme, but servers with different names can have the same address.

      For remote servers discovered via zeroconf, this name corresponds to the service name.

    • subtype

      String subtype()
      Server subtype. The server "type" is given by the scheme of its pool address (e.g. "tcp"). Some servers may provide additional subtypes, specifying the purpose of the pools they serve, or any other application-specific information.

      For remote servers discovered via zeroconf, these subtypes correspond to the server's service subtypes.

    • qualifiedName

      String qualifiedName()
      A name taking into account the server's subtype and guaranteed to be unique.

    • create

      void create(String name, PoolOptions opts) throws PoolException
      Creates a new pool, with the given name and options, in this server.

      Note that name should refer to the pool name sans its server part, i.e., be a relative, rather than absolute URI.

      Throws:
      PoolException - if the creation failed. Almost any kind of PoolException can be expected here. Besides network protocol errors, PoolException.Kind.BAD_ADDRESS (thrown as a BadAddressException) and PoolException.Kind.POOL_EXISTS (NoSuchPoolException) will perhaps be the most common error types.
      See Also:
      • Pool.create(String, PoolOptions)

    • dispose

      void dispose(String name) throws PoolException
      Removes the given pool from this server.

      Note that name should refer to the pool name sans its server part, i.e., be a relative, rather than absolute URI.

      Throws:
      PoolException - Almost any kind of PoolException can be expected here. Besides network errors, PoolException.Kind.BAD_ADDRESS (thrown as a BadAddressException) and PoolException.Kind.NO_SUCH_POOL (NoSuchPoolException) will perhaps be the most common error types.
      See Also:
      • Pool.dispose(String)

    • participate

      Hose participate(String name) throws PoolException
      Establishes a connection with the pool denoted by the given name.

      Note that name should refer to the pool name sans its server part, i.e., be a relative, rather than absolute URI. If no exceptions are thrown, you can rely on the returned Hose to be non-null and ready to use (although of course nothing prevents the network connection to go awry in the meantime).

      Throws:
      PoolException - In particular, a PoolException of kind PoolException.Kind.NO_SUCH_POOL (catchable as a NoSuchPoolException) will be thrown if the requested pool does not exist.
      See Also:
      • Pool.participate(String)

    • participate

      Hose participate(String name, PoolOptions opts) throws PoolException
      Tries to establish a connection with the pool denoted by the given name. If the pool exists, opts is ignored; otherwise, they'll be used to create a new pool with the given options. Either way, you'll get back a Hose connected to the pool, with the same guarantees as with participate(String).

      Note that name should refer to the pool name sans its server part, i.e., be a relative, rather than absolute URI.

      Throws:
      PoolException - No errors of kind PoolException.Kind.POOL_EXISTS or PoolException.Kind.NO_SUCH_POOL will be thrown.
      See Also:
      • Pool.participate(String, PoolOptions)

    • pools

      Set<String> pools() throws PoolException
      Returns a list of the names of pools in this server. See Pool.pools(java.lang.String) for details.
      Throws:
      PoolException
